Proverbs__06.1: My son, if thou be surety for thy friend, thou hast engaged fast thy hand to a stranger.
Proverbs__06.2: Thou art ensnared with the words of thy mouth, and caught with thy own words.
Proverbs__06.3: Do therefore, my son, what I say, and deliver thyself: because thou art fallen into the hand of thy neighbour. Run about, make haste, stir up thy friend:
Proverbs__06.4: Give not sleep to thy eyes, neither let thy eyelids slumber.
Proverbs__06.5: Deliver thyself as a doe from the hand, and as a bird from the hand of the fowler.
Proverbs__06.6: Go to the ant, O sluggard, and consider her ways, and learn wisdom:
Proverbs__06.7: Which, although she hath no guide, nor master, nor captain,
Proverbs__06.8: Provideth her meat for herself in the summer, and gathereth her food in the harvest.
Proverbs__06.9: How long wilt thou sleep, O sluggard? when wilt thou rise out of thy sleep?
Proverbs__06.10: Thou wilt sleep a little, thou wilt slumber a little, thou wilt fold thy hands a little to sleep:
Proverbs__06.11: And want shall come upon thee, as a traveller, and poverty as a man armed. But if thou be diligent, thy harvest shall come as a fountain, and want shall flee far from thee.
Proverbs__06.12: A man that is an apostate, an unprofitable man, walketh with a perverse mouth,
Proverbs__06.13: He winketh with the eyes, presseth with the foot, speaketh with the finger.
Proverbs__06.14: With a wicked heart he deviseth evil, and at all times he soweth discord.
Proverbs__06.15: To such a one his destruction shall presently come, and he shall suddenly be destroyed, and shall no longer have any remedy.
Proverbs__06.16: Six things there are, which the Lord hateth, and the seventh his soul detesteth:
Proverbs__06.17: Haughty eyes, a lying tongue, hands that shed innocent blood,
Proverbs__06.18: A heart that deviseth wicked plots, feet that are swift to run into mischief,
Proverbs__06.19: A deceitful witness that uttereth lies, and him that soweth discord among brethren.
Proverbs__06.20: My son, keep the commandments of thy father, and forsake not the law of thy mother.
Proverbs__06.21: Bind them in thy heart continually, and put them about thy neck.
Proverbs__06.22: When thou walkest, let them go with thee: when thou sleepest, let them keep thee; and when thou awakest, talk with them.
Proverbs__06.23: Because the commandment is a lamp, and the law a light, and reproofs of instruction are the way of life:
Proverbs__06.24: That they may keep thee from the evil woman, and from the flattering tongue of the stranger.
Proverbs__06.25: Let not thy heart covet her beauty, be not caught with her winks:
Proverbs__06.26: For the price of a harlot is scarce one loaf: but the woman catcheth the precious soul of a man.
Proverbs__06.27: Can a man hide fire in his bosom, and his garments not burn?
Proverbs__06.28: Or can he walk upon hot coals, and his feet not be burnt?
Proverbs__06.29: So he that goeth in to his neighbour's wife, shall not be clean when he shall touch her.
Proverbs__06.30:
<u>
                The fault is not so great
               </u>when a man hath stolen: for he stealeth to fill his hungry soul:
Proverbs__06.31: And if he be taken he shall restore sevenfold, and shall give up all the substance of his house.
Proverbs__06.32: But he that is an adulterer, for the folly of his heart shall destroy his own soul:
Proverbs__06.33: He gathereth to himself shame and dishonour, and his reproach shall not be blotted out:
Proverbs__06.34: Because the jealousy and rage of the husband will not spare in the day of revenge,
Proverbs__06.35: Nor will he yield to any man's prayers, nor will he accept for satisfaction ever so many gifts.
